column4: how do you learn what executable command you have via terminal?
? do you mean what program is run when you select Applications/.../terminal??
thanks i've been have this kind of problem with a lot on program with out gui's
so just list the files and find it that way?
so you do that everything you get a package without a gui?
no, just when I want to see what got installed where.
so do dpkg look for files with whatever name you give it?
do a dpkg -l | grep clamav to see what's installed.
then do a dpkg -L xxx where xxx is the name of the package you want to examin.
No, most files are elsewhere but the executables are in /usr/bin/ nhormally
take paticular notice of the file in the .../man/... directory.
that will tell you want man pages are there
yeah i noticed that i'm about to check it out.
if you see man/man1/clambc.1.gz then try man clambc
yeah i see that. so "man" will open a file with the name after it?
That's an over simplication, but yes.
well for here it save a lot of room the chat lol
